title: Taylor Swift says turning Jason Kelce’s daughters into cat fans after white lie was a ‘great challenge’
description: An innocent fib from former Philadelphia Eagles center Jason Kelce was undone when his young daughters got to meet Taylor Swift's friendly cats.
content:
reveled in her ability to convince Jason Kelce’s young daughters that cats are, in fact, not "poisonous."

During her appearance on the "New Heights" podcast, tight end Travis Kelce asked Swift how she felt about Jason telling his daughters that cats are poisonous, likely in an effort to dissuade them from asking for one.

"It was actually really a great challenge, because as soon as I got the kids around the cats, it was my goal to prove to them that they weren’t poisonous. And there’s no better way to prove that than to just hand them Benjamin, my rag doll cat, who lets humans hold him like he’s a baby," Swift said confidently.

CLICK HERE FOR MORE SPORTS COVERAGE ON

My favorite thing ever is when Benny (Jason’s 2-year-old) will come up to me and just go, ‘I find Benjamin. I find him,' And she’s just like over there, just laying with him and petting him and holding him."

Swift added that the girls get excited to be around her three cats, which she named Meredith Grey, Olivia Benson and Benjamin Button.

"I’m like, ‘Yup, and you know what? [Meredith] didn’t bite you at all, did she? And if she did bite you, she wouldn’t be poisonous.’ They’re like, ‘That’s not what our dad said.’ And I’m like, ‘Well.’"

JASON KELCE DEFENDS HIMSELF AFTER DEBUTING NEW LOOK IN PODCAST FEATURING TAYLOR SWIFT: 'DON'T HATE ME'

The international pop star, who joined the podcast Wednesday for the first time since her began in 2023, also revealed that Jason’s family may be getting a cat of their own after becoming friendly with hers.

"You’re getting a proper cat. You’re getting a cat that chases mice," she said. "What I have are not that. They sit around, and that’s enough."

Jason didn’t deny the speculation, adding that a "barn cat" wasn’t entirely out of the question.

CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

Jason and Kylie Kelce welcomed another member of the family earlier this year when they announced the birth of their fourth daughter, Finnley, in March.
summary: Taylor Swift has revealed that she successfully convinced Jason Kelce's daughters that cats are not poisonous. This was during her appearance on the "New Heights" podcast, where tight end Travis Kelce asked her about the situation. Swift explained that she used her three cats, named Maddel Grey, Olivia Benson and Benjamin Button, to prove their innocence. She also mentioned that Jason's family may be getting a cat after becoming friendly with her.
shortSummary: Taylor Swift successfully convinced Jason Kelce's daughters that cats are not poisonous, emphasizing their excitement for sharing their pet cats, and discussed plans for a new pet.

Taylor Swift has amassed global stardom with her hit songs that are loved by listeners around the world.
Born on December 13, 1989 in West Reading, Pennsylvania, Swift began as a country music artist before pivoting to pop.
Songs like “Love Story,” “You Belong With Me,” “We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together,” “I Knew You Were Trouble” and “Shake It Off” are among Swift's most popular songs.
Her fan base, known as the Swifies, are extremely loyal to the star, and dish out hundreds, even thousands of dollars to witness Swift's high-production concerts. Swift’s concerts are in such high demand that Ticketmaster shut down due to the volume of fans attempting to buy tickets for her “Eras” tour that took place through much of 2023 and continues in 2024.
Swift has broken many records and earned countless awards for the music she has released over the years. In 2024, she became the first artist to win album of the year four times when she took home the award for “Midnights.” During her acceptance speech, she announced her newest album,”The Tortured Poets Department” coming out in April.
Swift’s enormous level of fame has made many interested in her personal life, such as who the star is dating. She became all the buzz in the sports world when she began dating Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce in September 2023.
Since dating the football pro, she has had a frequentpresence at his NFL games, causing Swifies to tune in and attend the games as well. This has brought new fans, and lots of money to the league.

Travis Kelce is a tight end for the Kansas City Chiefs. He was drafted to the team in the third round of the 2013 NFL Draft.
Since his years playing with the Chiefs, he has won three Super Bowl titles. During the Super Bowl LVII matchup between the Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles, Kelce played against his brother Jason Kelce, marking the first time in NFL history that two brothers went head to head in a championship game. Jason has since retired from the league. In 2025, Kelce returned to the Super Bowl with the Chiefs in another matchup with the Eagles.
Travis has received many accolades through his time in the NFL. He has been named a Pro Bowler 10 times and in 2022, became the fastest tight end in history to reach 10,000 receiving yards.
Apart from No. 87’s time in the football world, he is quite the spectacle in the entertainment space. Kelce hosts a podcast “New Heights” with his brother Jason, named after Shaker Heights, Ohio, where the brothers grew up. The podcast surrounds topics including sports as well as pop culture.
He has also been thrust into the limelight due to his very public relationship with Taylor Swift. Since the two began dating in September 2023, Swift has attended numerous Chiefs' games, causing a lot of buzz around the pair’s budding relationship. Her presence has also caused many Swifties, her loyal fan base, to tune in and attend the Chiefs’ games allowing the NFL to rake in newfound money.

How much data does Fox News Go use?
Fox News Go uses about 2GB per hour of SD viewing and 4GB per hour of HD viewing. This can vary depending on your device and internet connection. If you are concerned about your data usage we recommend not streaming over a cellular network and contacting your Internet or Cellular Service Provider.
What broadcast quality will I get while streaming on my device?
Fox News will stream at the highest quality possible based on your device and internet connection quality. For the best quality we recommend streaming via Wi-Fi or 4G.
What channels are available on Fox News Go?
You can Watch Fox News Channel on Fox News Go and Fox Business Channel on Fox Business Go

Former Philadelphia Eagles center Jason Kelce defended himself on social media this week after his new look in the recent "New Heights" episode featuring pop star Taylor Swift turned some heads on social media.
Fans tuning into Wednesday night’s premiere, which at one point had reached over 1.2 million viewers, pointed out that eldest Kelce brother appeared to have dyed his salt and pepper facial hair black.
He also appeared to have dyed his hair a similar color.
CLICK HERE FOR MORE SPORTS COVERAGE ON FOXNEWS.COM
In response to former NFL quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick commenting on X that he felt "betrayed" to a teaser clip of the episode, Kelce defended the new look.
"I promise the dye was for a good reason, don’t hate me," Kelce wrote without establishing what the "good reason" was.
Kelce’s new look debuted during Swift’s first appearance on the podcast, where she unveiled her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl."
In addition to discussing her love story with Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, the trio discussed Swift’s new-found love for football.
"Jason, on our first date, I legitimately asked him what it was like when the Chiefs played the Eagles in the Super Bowl, and he looked across the field across the line of scrimmage and saw his brother standing on the other, like five feet in front of him on the field," she recalled.
"He didn’t even look at me. Like, I now know what an insane question that was. … I thought everyone was on the field at the same time."
CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP
Swift then detailed how her lack of knowledge of football quickly turned into a passion, recalling how excited she was when the Chiefs drafted wide receiver Xavier Worthy in the first round of the 2024 NFL Draft.
"I became obsessed with it. I became a person who was running through the halls of my house screaming, ‘We drafted Xavier Worthy!’ My friends are like, 'Who body-snatched you? What do you mean we drafted Xavier Worthy?"
Fox News Digital’s Ryan Gaydos contributed to this report.
Follow Fox News Digital’s sports coverage on X, and subscribe to the Fox News Sports Huddle newsletter.

argos_summary: During her appearance on the 'New Heights' podcast, Taylor Swift shared how she successfully convinced Jason Kelce's daughters that cats are not poisonous, despite their father's playful fib. Swift, who brought her own cats to meet the girls, noted their excitement and how they quickly warmed up to the animals. She also hinted that Jason's family might consider getting a cat of their own after their positive interactions.
